column2: even after I finally got the meat that definitely had been sitting on the side for a bit
column3: I was quite disappointed. Though smokey
column4: the meat was also somehow tough and fatty at the same time. How can brisket be tough AND fatty? The ribs didn't do much better. There was little meat on the bones
column5: and the ribs definitely tasted a bit dried out like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for too long. What a let down! IMO
column6: go try another place if you want good Texas BBQ
column7: because The Pit Room certainly isn't it!
